title: Girl, 6, Shot In West Pullman, Police Say
content:
CHICAGO — A 6-year-old girl was shot in West Pullman Sunday night, according to police.
The girl was getting out of a car with an adult at 9:09 p.m. in the 12000 block of South Perry Avenue Sunday when shots rang out, police said.
She was struck in her right arm and was taken to Roseland Community Hospital before being transferred to Advocate Christ Medical Center in good condition, police said.
No arrests have been made.
